thread.title: We translated Britain's best anti-Trump protest signs
thread.title_full: We translated Britain's best anti-Trump protest signs

author: Gianluca Mezzofiore
title: We translated Britain's best anti-Trump protest signs
text:
When it comes time to protest, Britons respond in the most colourful and creative ways.
Thousands of people descended on the streets of UK cities from Edinburgh to London to protest against the controversial travel ban on seven Muslim-majority countries imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump.
SEE ALSO: All the best protest signs from the weekend of Muslim ban demonstrations
As a petition calling for Prime Minister Theresa May to block Trump's planned state visit to the UK gathers more than 1.6 million signatures, demonstrators held signs and placards that showed off their irreducible regional genius.
The demonstration in London, organised by columnist Owen Jones, took place outside 10 Downing Street. Protests also took place in Manchester, Glasgow, Edinburgh, Cardiff, Newcastle, Sheffield, Oxford, Cambridge, Brighton, Gloucester, Leeds, York, Liverpool, Leicester and several other towns and cities.
Here's a roundup of the best locutions and dialectical expressions:
London ‚Äî "Trump is a wasteman" How to know you're at a London protest. LOL. #StandUpToTrump pic.twitter.com/5y75ssNLvi
‚Äî Tansy E Hoskins (@TansyHoskins) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Trump is good for nothing."
Manchester ‚Äî "No one likes it when a Trump follows through" Best sign #manchesterprotest #dumptrump #nomorefear pic.twitter.com/z0NvUKV9Dj
‚Äî Chloe Barnes (@chloecbarnes) January 30, 2017
Translation: "No one likes it when a fart follows through."
Manchester ‚Äî "Donald Trump sells Avon" This placard at tonight's protest in Manchester. Favourite. pic.twitter.com/vbm03F4bdV
‚Äî „Ö§„Ö§„Ö§ (@fxxckoff) January 31, 2017
Translation: "Donald Trump is a representative of the Avon company (Scottish lingo used in popular culture as the ultimate insult)"
Manchester ‚Äî "Keep Trump outside how bow dah?" Manchester has the best protest signs hands down pic.twitter.com/C0werCqbAN
‚Äî ≈Ç (@M_Ullah) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Keep Trump out of the country, how about that?"
Newcastle ‚Äî "Trump can't hack trebs" Only in Newcastle would you see this at a Trump protest! üòÇüòÇ pic.twitter.com/nfMFU45Ktp
‚Äî The Empress Bar (@EmpressBar) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Trump cannot handle treble measures of spirits in his drinks."
Cardiff ‚Äî "Tampin' about Trump" The welshest placard of the day pic.twitter.com/slPj9Oy7ww
‚Äî Tony Rivers (@TonyRivers1927) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Very angry about Trump."
Cardiff ‚Äî "I'm going to miss Pobol y Cwm tonight. Theresa May keep Trump away" You know the Welsh mean business when... pic.twitter.com/b3thpUgPKL
‚Äî Dan Roberts (@danroberts11) January 30, 2017
@danroberts11 hello! It's me in the photo. Here's the other side of my sign pic.twitter.com/16i2PRzdmT
‚Äî Debra Humphries (@DebraHumphries4) January 31, 2017
Translation: "I'm going to miss Pobol y Cwm (Welsh soap opera) tonight".
Edinburgh ‚Äî "Your maw was an immigrant you absolute roaster" By far the best protest sign in Edinburgh tonight üôÉxx #ScotlandAgainstTrump pic.twitter.com/uaTKMXw9Vk
‚Äî Muriel üëë‚ú®üêØ (@itsjustmuriel) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Your mother was an immigrant you absolute cunt/twat."
Glasgow ‚Äî "Chapati tae yer heid ya bam" Scottish protest signs 3/ #ScotlandAgainstTrump #MuslimBan pic.twitter.com/IFB2lNHyga
‚Äî Lorna Gordon (@bbclornag) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Chapati to your head you 'bampot' (crackpot, nitwit, unhinged, incompetent/inept individual."
Edinburgh ‚Äî "Yer maw was an immigrant ya fucken bawbag" A message to @realDonaldTrump from Edinburgh #MuslimBan #ScotlandAgainstTrump pic.twitter.com/m0OdQvDlMQ
‚Äî Carolyn Scott (@TotallyCarolyn) January 30, 2017
Translation: "Your mother was an immigrant, you fucking 'scrotum' (Glaswegian term for annoying, irritating person)"
Dundee ‚Äî "It's a shite state of affairs" Some very Scottish protesting pic.twitter.com/F5A7UG4m5W
‚Äî Philip Dorward (@PhilDorward) January 30, 2017
Nottingham ‚Äî "Laundry is the only thing that should be separated by colour" Great poster at #Nottingham #MuslimBanprotest . Hundreds stand against racism, great turnout! pic.twitter.com/NQvbLTe0sX
‚Äî Sally Longford (@SallyLongford) January 30, 2017
BONUS: All 13 times the stars at the SAG Awards threw shade at Donald Trump
